headings: What Can You Do With a Studio Art Degree?
Why Earn My Studio Art Degree at Angelo State?
paragraphs: If these words resonate with you and you enjoy exploring different artistic outlets, majoring in studio art could be the perfect fit as you continue your educational journey.

Our program will help you expand your creativity beyond the fundamentals of art. You can tailor your degree plan to fit your interests, with specializations including art generalist, graphic design, painting and drawing, printmaking, ceramics or sculpture. You’ll have access to create your art in some of the newest facilities on campus, as well as have the opportunity to submit pieces for public display on campus and at various venues in the San Angelo community.

Our faculty are all practicing artists who have earned regional or national recognition. Our smaller class sizes allow you to really get to know your instructors, and you can even work with them on individual projects.
ASU Distinguished ScholarshipsOur premier scholarships are awarded based on your academic achievement, and you don’t even have to apply. You are automatically considered once you are admitted to ASU.
General ScholarshipsWe offer over 600 different types of scholarships. You can apply for both our general scholarships and degree-specific scholarships with one application.
Blue and Gold GuaranteeIf you have financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State.

Earning your studio art degree will open career doors in a variety of settings, including design firms, museums and art galleries, photography studios and all levels of art education. You can also be a self-employed studio artist or move on to graduate school.
Our graduates enjoy successful careers as studio artists, graphic designers, museum and gallery installers, college and museum educators, photographers and public school art teachers.

Our updated and competitive graphic design curriculum includes new courses in 2-D animation, branding and marketing, computer interaction design (UI/UX-Web and Interactive Design), as well as an established professional internship program.

Have your work featured in Gallery 193, our on-campus teaching gallery that features both professional artists and student exhibitions. The ASU Mayer Museum also hosts major art exhibitions each year. Plus, our program takes annual field trips to major art collections in Texas, including the Kimbell Art Museum in Fort Worth, the Dallas Museum of Art and the Chinati Foundation in Marfa.

Our new ceramics studio is located in the ASU Mayer Museum and includes electric, raku and two large gas kilns. It’s also equipped with clay 3-D printers and the latest in ceramics technology. We have a close working relationship with the San Angelo Museum of Fine Arts and its Concho Clay Studio, collaborating on the National Ceramics Symposium, National Ceramics Competition and National Ceramics Invitational.

Take your education to the next level in theASU Honors Program. Through special courses, cultural events, research and community engagement, we’ll help you transform your intellectual and personal talents into marketable skills for your future. You’ll also have the opportunity to participate in prestigious internships, fellowships and other programs to reach your full potential.

OurFreshman Collegeis a one-stop resource for programs and services that help you transition into college life, improve your communication skills, and engage in active learning. You can also get academic help in theMath LabandWriting Center, receive peer mentoring and tutoring throughSupplemental Instruction, or set up onlinetutoringsessions.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.
